The Science & Story Behind It

This cultivar is a fusion of aesthetic appeal and culinary chemistry:

  • The stunning purple colour is due to anthocyanins, the same powerful antioxidant pigments found in blueberries and blackberries. In the plant, these pigments act as a natural sunscreen, protecting the leaves from intense light stress.
  • Its unique, less-bitter flavour profile is linked to a different balance of thujone and camphor - the compounds responsible for sage’s characteristic sharpness - alongside higher levels of fruity esters, a trait selected for during its development.
  • Historically, sage (Salvia, from the Latin salvare, “to save”) has been revered for its medicinal properties, particularly for memory and digestion. While ‘Plum-Sage’ is bred for cuisine, it retains the aromatic compounds that have linked this herb to wellness for centuries.

In short, Compact Purple Sage ‘Plum-Sage’ is a scented jewel of the herb garden, a dual-purpose plant that provides a continuous harvest of uniquely flavoured, gorgeously coloured leaves to add a touch of visual drama and sophisticated flavour to your cooking.
